attributes.action: Make justice for single Moms who were let down by CSA because of legal loopholes
attributes.additional_details: CSA closed my case in July 2015 and I only found out about it in Oct  2015 when I called them.  The letter was never posted to me and I had to ask them to post the letters to me later on.  CSA didn't look at the evidence I provided them with and believed the fake stories my ex husband provided.  I spent many hours on the phone with them, investing a lot of time and  psychological anguish to deal with them. I have been diagnosed with MS and have no support from the UK government at all.
attributes.background: I am a single Mum with 2 children.  In 2006 I separated from my husband.  From 2009 I approached CSA to help me recover maintenance & was let  down by the system.  I will become homeless because  of the lack of interest the CSA paid to the case.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition in its current form as it does not call for a clear action from the UK Government and Parliament. 

This website explains how you can make a complaint about the CSA:

https://www.gov.uk/child-maintenance/complaints-and-appeals

If you would like there to be a specific change to the way the child maintenance system works, you could start a new petition asking for that specific change.
